articles.headline: Hard Lessons (Thanks, Amazon) Breathe New Life Into Retail Stores
articles.snippet: Sales are booming at major chains that have taken cues from their giant online rival — signs of a revival in a $3.5 trillion industry.
articles.abstract: Sales are booming at major chains that have taken cues from their giant online rival — signs of a revival in a $3.5 trillion industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Malls are being hollowed out. Shops are closing by the thousands. Retailers are going bankrupt.

articles.headline: Growth Has Lifted Counties That Voted for Trump. Mostly, It’s the Wealthy Ones.
articles.snippet: President Trump’s economy has left the most distressed swaths of the country waiting for their share of the good times.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s economy has left the most distressed swaths of the country waiting for their share of the good times.
articles.lead_paragraph: ST. CHARLES, Mo. — The prosperity is apparent on the way into town: the 21-floor casino resort and spa on one side of the interstate, and on the other a freshly built retail quarter of boutiques, a brand-new Hilton hotel and a P.F. Chang’s. It unfolds from there along the highways heading west with more gleaming office parks and multiplying subdivisions.
articles.byline: By Campbell Robertson, Jim Tankersley and Whitten Sabbatini

articles.headline: Facebook’s Private Groups Offer Refuge to Fringe Figures
articles.snippet: Many private groups reviewed by The Times contained content and behavior that appeared to violate Facebook rules, like those against hate speech.
articles.abstract: Many private groups reviewed by The Times contained content and behavior that appeared to violate Facebook rules, like those against hate speech.
articles.lead_paragraph: Much of the empire built by Alex Jones, the Infowars founder and social media shock jock, vanished this summer when Facebook suspended Mr. Jones for 30 days and took down four of his pages for repeatedly violating its rules against bullying and hate speech. YouTube, Apple and other companies also took action against Mr. Jones. But a private Infowars Facebook group with more than 110,000 members, which had survived the crackdown, remained a hive of activity.

articles.headline: Amazon Sets Its Sights on the $88 Billion Online Ad Market
articles.snippet: The online retailer is moving aggressively into digital advertising, emerging as a major competitor to Google and Facebook.
articles.abstract: The online retailer is moving aggressively into digital advertising, emerging as a major competitor to Google and Facebook.
articles.lead_paragraph: Verizon doesn’t sell its mobile phones or wireless plans over Amazon. Nor does it offer Fios, its high-speed internet service. But Verizon does advertise on Amazon.

articles.headline: As Kavanaugh Hearings Begin, Two Views of Women’s Rights Emerge
articles.snippet: Democrats are casting Brett Kavanaugh as a threat to abortion rights. Republicans portray him as an advocate for women.
articles.abstract: Democrats are casting Brett Kavanaugh as a threat to abortion rights. Republicans portray him as an advocate for women.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Two wildly different portraits of Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh are set to emerge on Tuesday when he appears on Capitol Hill for the opening of his Supreme Court confirmation hearings. One is a champion for women; the other a threat to women’s rights.

articles.headline: Double Blow to Brazil Museum: Neglect, Then Flames
articles.snippet: When Brazilians look at the shell of their National Museum, some see a symbol of the hollowing out of their country and the near-abandonment of basic services.
articles.abstract: When Brazilians look at the shell of their National Museum, some see a symbol of the hollowing out of their country and the near-abandonment of basic services.
articles.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — The stately national museum, once home to Brazil’s royal family, was still smoldering at sunrise on Monday when scores of researchers, museum workers and anthropologists began gathering outside, dressed in black.
articles.byline: By Manuela Andreoni, Ernesto Londoño and Lis Moriconi

articles.headline: A Facebook War: Libyans Battle on the Streets and on Screens
articles.snippet: A new wave of fighting shook Tripoli this past week. For many combatants Facebook, which has huge influence in Libya, is a key weapon.
articles.abstract: A new wave of fighting shook Tripoli this past week. For many combatants Facebook, which has huge influence in Libya, is a key weapon.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — When a new bout of fighting between rival militias engulfed the Libyan capital in recent days, badly shaking the fragile United Nations-backed government, some combatants picked up rifles and rocket launchers and headed into the streets.
articles.byline: By Declan Walsh and Suliman Ali Zway

articles.headline: Amazon Hits $1,000,000,000,000 in Value, Following Apple
articles.snippet: Apple became the first public company to be worth $1 trillion. Amazon hit the same milestone a month later, but the reasons for the e-commerce titan’s rise are more complicated.
articles.abstract: Apple became the first public company to be worth $1 trillion. Amazon hit the same milestone a month later, but the reasons for the e-commerce titan’s rise are more complicated.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When Apple’s market value crossed a trillion dollars last month, the reason was simple: It makes devices that a lot of people are willing to spend a lot of money on.
